newsitem.title: USA: May to invest $3.4 billion over five years.
newsitem.headline: May to invest $3.4 billion over five years.

text.p: May Department Stores Co said Friday it will invest $3.4 billion over the next five years.
By the end of 2001, May will add nearly 100 new stores, remodel or expand 100 other stores, enhance distribution centers, and improve systems and equipment to achieve cost savings, it added.

May said it will invest almost $450 million in 1997 to open 13 new stores, adding two million square feet of retail space by year-end. The new stores include six Lord & Taylor stores, two Strawbridge's stores, two Foley's stores, and three Filene's stores.
Three of the Lord & Taylor sores and one of the Strawbridge's opened earlier in 1997.
It plans to remodel or expand 29 other stores, adding another 430,000 square feet of retail space, May said.
May operates 366 department stores in 30 states and the District of Columbia.
